```suggestion
/-- If `K` is a compact set in a preregular space and `s âŠ‡ K` is a Borel measurable superset,
```
deprecate this lemma?
missing deprecation date? Same thing several times below.

```suggestion
/-- In an Râ‚ space, the `Specializes` relation is symmetric, i.e., an Râ‚ is an Râ‚€ space.  -/
```
Since Râ‚€ spaces are not defined in this file, I think the docstring is clearer if the comment on Râ‚€ spaces comes at the end. Same thing below.
Sometimes you use preregular and sometimes you use Râ‚ in the doctrings. Could you use Râ‚ all the time, for coherence?

```suggestion
/-- If `K` and `L` are disjoint compact sets in a preregular topological space
```

```suggestion
/-- In a weakly locally compact preregular space,
```
Same thing below.

```suggestion
Some lemmas are formulated using the latter assumptions below.
```
deprecation date?

```suggestion
@[deprecated inferInstance] -- Since 28 Jan 2024
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive (attr := deprecated)] -- Since 28 Jan 2024
```

```suggestion
/-- In an Râ‚ space, `Specializes` is equivalent to `Inseparable`. -/
```

Why do you suggest removing the "i.e." parts? I added them on purpose: if we ever decide to add Râ‚€ spaces (i.e., if we start caring about spaces which are Râ‚€ but not Râ‚ for some reason), then one can immediately see the lemmas that need to be generalized from Râ‚ to Râ‚€.
Fine then.

```suggestion
/-- In an Râ‚ space, the `Specializes` relation is symmetric. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- In an Râ‚ space, `Specializes` is equivalent to `Inseparable`. -/
```
This is a docstring for `Specializes.inseparable`, not for the `iff` lemma.

```suggestion
/-- In an Râ‚ space, the `Specializes` relation is symmetric. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- In an Râ‚ space, `Specializes` implies `Inseparable`,
```
